message: I'm assuming that the redis client doesn't have any sort of connection pooling here...
Assuming you mean redis-py that is
It does, in fact, have a rather complex connection pool system ...
it does? ok didn't realize that.
Connections are also automatically scoped to thread locals, etc etc. Basically the whole library Does The Right Thing (tm).
@coderanger does it persist connections when you reopen the same connection with the same params?
